t: Then*pn a shoot will grow from the stump of Jesse, and*ln a branch from his roots will bear fruit.
The*ln Spirit of the Lord*s will rest on him— a*ln Spirit of wisdom and understanding, a*ln Spirit of counsel and strength, a*ln Spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord.*s
His*ln delight will be in the fear of the Lord.*s He*ln will not judge by*ln what he sees with his eyes, he*ln will not execute justice by*ln what he hears with his ears,

but*ln he will judge the poor righteously and*ln execute justice for the oppressed of the land. He*ln will strike the land with*ln a scepter from his mouth, and*ln he will kill the wicked with*ln a command from his lips.
Righteousness*ln will be a belt around his hips; faithfulness*ln will be a belt around his waist.
The*pn wolf will dwell with the lamb, and*ln the leopard will lie down with the goat. The*ln calf, the young lion, and the fattened calf will be together, and*ln a child will lead them.
The*ln cow and the bear will graze, their*ln young ones will lie down together, and*ln the lion will eat straw like cattle.
An*ln infant will play beside the cobra’s pit, and*ln a toddler will put his hand into a snake’s den.
They*ln will not harm or destroy each other on*ln my entire holy mountain, for*ln the land will be as full of*ln the knowledge of the Lord*s as*ln the sea is filled with water.
On*pn that day the root of Jesse will*ln stand as a banner for the peoples. The*ln nations will look to him for guidance, and*ln his resting place will be glorious.

On*p that day the Lord will extend his hand a second time to recover the remnant of his people who survive — from Assyria, Egypt, Pathros, Cush, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and the coasts and islands of the west.
He*pn will lift up a banner for the nations and*ln gather the dispersed of Israel; he*ln will collect the scattered of Judah from*ln the four corners of the earth.
Ephraim’s*ln envy will cease; Judah’s*ln harassing will end. Ephraim*ln will no longer be envious of Judah, and*ln Judah will not harass Ephraim.

But*ln they will swoop down on*ln the Philistine flank to the west. Together*ln they will plunder the people of the east. They*ln will extend their power over Edom and Moab, and*ln the Ammonites will be their subjects.
The*ln Lord*s will divide the Gulf of Suez. He*ln will wave his hand over the Euphrates with*ln his mighty wind and*ln will split it into seven streams, letting*ln people walk through on foot.
There*ln will be a highway for the remnant of his people who*ln will survive from Assyria, as*ln there was for Israel when*ln they came up from the land of Egypt.
